verses.roman:
vande taṁ śrīmad-advaitā-
cāryam adbhuta-ceṣṭitam
yasya prasādād ajño 'pi
tat-svarūpaṁ nirūpayet

synonyms: vande—I offer my respectful obeisances; tam—unto Him; śrīmat—with all opulences; advaita-ācāryam—Śrī Advaita Ācārya; adbhuta-ceṣṭitam—whose activities are wonderful; yasya—of whom; prasādāt—by the mercy; ajñaḥ api—even a foolish person; tat-svarūpam—His characteristics; nirūpayet—may describe.
translation: I offer my respectful obeisances to Śrī Advaita Ācārya, whose activities are all wonderful. By His mercy, even a foolish person can describe His characteristics.
